title: Remove Practitioner banner and refine Access Code gate visuals

requirements.summary: Remove the Aurora Arcana banner image from the PractitionerAuthority section while keeping TikTok and Instagram links intact.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/components/PractitionerAuthority.tsx, the bottom banner block is removed (or otherwise not rendered) so the banner is no longer shown on the landing page.
The TikTok link to https://tiktok.com/@auroraarcanallc remains visible and functional.
The Instagram link to https://instagram.com/auroraarcanallc remains visible and functional.
No other PractitionerAuthority content (headshot, biography copy) is removed as part of this change.

file_operations.description: Remove (or conditionally disable) the bottom "Aurora Arcana Banner" rendering block so no banner image is displayed, leaving the headshot, bio copy, and TikTok/Instagram social links unchanged and functional.

requirements.summary: Visually enhance the access-code gate screen to feel more enticing and mysterious while preserving the dark + gold design and keeping gate behavior unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: The locked gate UI in frontend/src/components/AccessCodeGate.tsx is visually enhanced (e.g., richer background treatment, more deliberate lighting/glow, subtle motion/animation, improved typography/spacing) while preserving the current dark + gold palette.
User-facing text on the gate remains in English.
The functional behavior of the gate remains unchanged: code "1122" unlocks, incorrect codes show an error, and sessionStorage persistence continues to work as currently implemented.
The refined visuals do not reduce usability: input is clearly discoverable, error text remains legible, and the page works on mobile and desktop sizes.

file_operations.description: Refine the locked-gate layout styling only (no logic changes): add a more deliberate layered background treatment, enhance gold glow/lighting around the lock + call-to-action, improve typography/spacing hierarchy, and introduce subtle, non-distracting animation/motion accents while keeping all user-facing text in English and preserving the existing code-check + sessionStorage behavior (code remains "1122").

Add/adjust global utility classes and keyframe animations used by the AccessCodeGate visuals (e.g., subtle shimmer/ambient glow/slow drift), ensuring they stay within the existing dark + gold palette and remain responsive/accessible (legible text, non-obscuring effects).
